llm_results: [{"detection_name": "LLM: GraphQL introspection", "detection": "safe", "category": "Injection Attacks", "description": "The GraphQL endpoint returns detailed schema validation errors that reveal internal type information. The response explicitly states that the field 'createPost' is not defined on type 'Query', which discloses schema structure and allows an attacker to probe and enumerate available types/fields by iteratively testing queries. This is an information disclosure / introspection risk. While not as severe as unauthenticated data leakage or mutation execution, it facilitates discovery of available operations and attack surface. Recommended mitigations include returning generic error messages for invalid queries, disabling verbose schema errors in production, and restricting introspection or query error details based on authentication/authorization.", "evidence": "Error message: \"Cannot query field \\\"createPost\\\" on type \\\"Query\\\".\" (extensions.code: \"GRAPHQL_VALIDATION_FAILED\")", "confidence": 0.9, "llm_analysis": {"is_vulnerable": true, "vulnerability_type": "GraphQL introspection", "severity": "LOW", "confidence": 0.9, "evidence": "Error message: \"Cannot query field \\\"createPost\\\" on type \\\"Query\\\".\" (extensions.code: \"GRAPHQL_VALIDATION_FAILED\")", "explanation": "The GraphQL endpoint returns detailed schema validation errors that reveal internal type information. The response explicitly states that the field 'createPost' is not defined on type 'Query', which discloses schema structure and allows an attacker to probe and enumerate available types/fields by iteratively testing queries. This is an information disclosure / introspection risk. While not as severe as unauthenticated data leakage or mutation execution, it facilitates discovery of available operations and attack surface. Recommended mitigations include returning generic error messages for invalid queries, disabling verbose schema errors in production, and restricting introspection or query error details based on authentication/authorization."}}]

llm_results: [{"detection_name": "LLM: field_suggestions", "detection": "safe", "category": "Unknown", "description": "The GraphQL response returns explicit field suggestions and exposes type/field names (CreatePostInput, Post, title). This disclosure allows an attacker to enumerate the schema and discover valid field names by trial-and-error, which can assist further reconnaissance or targeted attacks. While this does not itself execute code or expose sensitive data, it is an information disclosure issue that can increase the risk profile. Mitigation: disable automatic suggestion text in error messages or return generic validation errors that do not reveal schema details; enforce rate limits and authentication to reduce automated enumeration.", "evidence": "Error messages contain field suggestions and schema names, e.g. \"Field \\\"tilte\\\" is not defined by type \\\"CreatePostInput\\\". Did you mean \\\"title\\\"?\" and \"Cannot query field \\\"titel\\\" on type \\\"Post\\\". Did you mean \\\"title\\\"?\" (also references to \"CreatePostInput.title\")", "confidence": 0.95, "llm_analysis": {"is_vulnerable": true, "vulnerability_type": "field_suggestions", "severity": "LOW", "confidence": 0.95, "evidence": "Error messages contain field suggestions and schema names, e.g. \"Field \\\"tilte\\\" is not defined by type \\\"CreatePostInput\\\". Did you mean \\\"title\\\"?\" and \"Cannot query field \\\"titel\\\" on type \\\"Post\\\". Did you mean \\\"title\\\"?\" (also references to \"CreatePostInput.title\")", "explanation": "The GraphQL response returns explicit field suggestions and exposes type/field names (CreatePostInput, Post, title). This disclosure allows an attacker to enumerate the schema and discover valid field names by trial-and-error, which can assist further reconnaissance or targeted attacks. While this does not itself execute code or expose sensitive data, it is an information disclosure issue that can increase the risk profile. Mitigation: disable automatic suggestion text in error messages or return generic validation errors that do not reveal schema details; enforce rate limits and authentication to reduce automated enumeration."}}]

[{"detection_name": "LLM: Introspection", "detection": "safe", "category": "Injection Attacks", "description": "The GraphQL endpoint returns a validation error that exposes schema-level information \u2014 specifically that there is a type named 'Query' and that 'createPost' is not a field on it. This leaks internal schema details and can help an attacker infer available types/operations (for example, that 'createPost' may be a Mutation rather than a Query) and enumerate the API. While this is not a full introspection query response, it is an information disclosure that facilitates schema discovery. Severity is rated LOW because the leak is limited (a single error message) rather than a full introspection result, and there is no direct evidence of sensitive data exposure or enabled full-introspection, but it is still a security concern and should be handled by returning generic error messages or disabling verbose schema errors in production.", "evidence": "Error message: \"Cannot query field \\\"createPost\\\" on type \\\"Query\\\".\"", "confidence": 0.6, "llm_analysis": {"is_vulnerable": true, "vulnerability_type": "Introspection", "severity": "LOW", "confidence": 0.6, "evidence": "Error message: \"Cannot query field \\\"createPost\\\" on type \\\"Query\\\".\"", "explanation": "The GraphQL endpoint returns a validation error that exposes schema-level information \u2014 specifically that there is a type named 'Query' and that 'createPost' is not a field on it. This leaks internal schema details and can help an attacker infer available types/operations (for example, that 'createPost' may be a Mutation rather than a Query) and enumerate the API. While this is not a full introspection query response, it is an information disclosure that facilitates schema discovery. Severity is rated LOW because the leak is limited (a single error message) rather than a full introspection result, and there is no direct evidence of sensitive data exposure or enabled full-introspection, but it is still a security concern and should be handled by returning generic error messages or disabling verbose schema errors in production."}}]

While this is not directly exploitable like injection, it is an information disclosure that facilitates schema discovery and automated enumeration by attackers, so it should be addressed (for example by turning off or generalizing suggestion messages in production).", "evidence": "Cannot query field \"titel\" on type \"Post\". While this is not directly exploitable like injection, it is an information disclosure that facilitates schema discovery and automated enumeration by attackers, so it should be addressed (for example by turning off or generalizing suggestion messages in production)."}}]

[{"detection_name": "LLM: Introspection/Schema Disclosure", "detection": "potential", "category": "Injection Attacks", "description": "The GraphQL endpoint returns detailed validation errors that include schema identifiers (field name 'createPost' and type 'Query'). Although an explicit __schema or __type introspection query was not returned, this error discloses schema structure and can be abused to enumerate available types and fields by probing. Such error-based schema disclosure is effectively an introspection risk because it reveals internal API schema information. Recommend suppressing detailed schema/error messages in production, disabling or restricting introspection, and implementing rate-limiting/authorization on GraphQL endpoints.", "evidence": "\"message\": \"Cannot query field \\\"createPost\\\" on type \\\"Query\\\".\" (extensions.code: \"GRAPHQL_VALIDATION_FAILED\")", "confidence": 0.6, "llm_analysis": {"is_vulnerable": true, "vulnerability_type": "Introspection/Schema Disclosure", "severity": "MEDIUM", "confidence": 0.6, "evidence": "\"message\": \"Cannot query field \\\"createPost\\\" on type \\\"Query\\\".\" (extensions.code: \"GRAPHQL_VALIDATION_FAILED\")", "explanation": "The GraphQL endpoint returns detailed validation errors that include schema identifiers (field name 'createPost' and type 'Query'). Although an explicit __schema or __type introspection query was not returned, this error discloses schema structure and can be abused to enumerate available types and fields by probing. Such error-based schema disclosure is effectively an introspection risk because it reveals internal API schema information. Recommend suppressing detailed schema/error messages in production, disabling or restricting introspection, and implementing rate-limiting/authorization on GraphQL endpoints."}}]

llm_results: [{"detection_name": "LLM: field_suggestions", "detection": "safe", "category": "Unknown", "description": "The GraphQL error responses include explicit field suggestions and type/field names (e.g., suggesting \"title\" for \"titl\" and revealing the CreatePostInput type and required field 'body'). This leaks schema details that assist an attacker in discovering valid field and input names, enabling schema enumeration and more efficient probing. While this does not directly exfiltrate data, it is an information-disclosure issue that increases attack surface. Recommend disabling verbose/auto-suggestion error text in production (return generic validation errors), limit introspection in sensitive environments, and log detailed errors server-side only.", "evidence": "Error message: \"Cannot query field \\\"titl\\\" on type \\\"Post\\\". Did you mean \\\"title\\\"?\" and other validation errors revealing types/fields such as \"Field \\\"CreatePostInput.body\\\" of required type \\\"String!\\\" was not provided.\"", "confidence": 0.95, "llm_analysis": {"is_vulnerable": true, "vulnerability_type": "field_suggestions", "severity": "LOW", "confidence": 0.95, "evidence": "Error message: \"Cannot query field \\\"titl\\\" on type \\\"Post\\\". Did you mean \\\"title\\\"?\" and other validation errors revealing types/fields such as \"Field \\\"CreatePostInput.body\\\" of required type \\\"String!\\\" was not provided.\"", "explanation": "The GraphQL error responses include explicit field suggestions and type/field names (e.g., suggesting \"title\" for \"titl\" and revealing the CreatePostInput type and required field 'body'). [{"detection_name": "LLM: GraphQL Introspection / Schema Disclosure", "detection": "safe", "category": "Injection Attacks", "description": "The GraphQL error message reveals schema-related information (it names a field attempted and the type it was checked against). While this is not an explicit __schema introspection query response, it discloses internal schema details that can help an attacker enumerate operations and object types. This is a form of schema disclosure/introspection leakage. Recommendation: suppress or genericize GraphQL validation/errors in production, disable or restrict GraphQL introspection (or require authentication), and implement error masking, rate limiting, and proper access controls to reduce information leakage.", "evidence": "Cannot query field \"createPost\" on type \"Query\".", "confidence": 0.6, "llm_analysis": {"is_vulnerable": true, "vulnerability_type": "GraphQL Introspection / Schema Disclosure", "severity": "LOW", "confidence": 0.6, "evidence": "Cannot query field \"createPost\" on type \"Query\".", "explanation": "The GraphQL error message reveals schema-related information (it names a field attempted and the type it was checked against). While this is not an explicit __schema introspection query response, it discloses internal schema details that can help an attacker enumerate operations and object types. This is a form of schema disclosure/introspection leakage. Recommendation: suppress or genericize GraphQL validation/errors in production, disable or restrict GraphQL introspection (or require authentication), and implement error masking, rate limiting, and proper access controls to reduce information leakage."}}]
